messages.title: The Lib Dem Difference
messages.content: Liberal Democrats in government: Increased the starting level for paying income tax. [David Cameron said it could not be afforded]. With Liberal Democrats in government: We will stop planned cuts in expenditure and raise £8bn of taxes in the next parliament which will include only raising it from the wealthiest in society and from companies that aren’t paying their fair share in the UK. Action will be taken to cut CO2 emissions and reduce the risk of flooding.

messages.title: A future Conservative majority government would:
messages.content: Take no action to reduce carbon dioxide emissions.

messages.title: Record of Delivery
messages.content: Our Record 2010 - 2015: Cut the deficit by half, reducing borrowing by £3,000 for every household in Britain; Given an £800 tax cut to low and middle income workers; Increased the health budget each year to improve services and provide 6,000 more doctors; Provided an extra £2.5bn a year for struggling school kids.

messages.title: Priorities 2015 - 2020
messages.content: Finish the job of balancing the books, on time and fairly; Cut Income Tax by a further £400 for ordinary workers; Guarantee mental health equality by increasing health spending by £8bn a year; Protect education spending from cradle to college.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Stop planned cuts in expenditure, raise £8bn of taxes from the wealthiest and companies not paying their fair share, cut the deficit by half.
Cut CO2 emissions, reduce the risk of flooding, take no action to reduce carbon dioxide emissions under Conservative majority government.
Increased the health budget each year to improve services and provide 6,000 more doctors, guarantee mental health equality by increasing health spending by £8bn a year.
Provided an extra £2.5bn a year for struggling school kids, protect education spending from cradle to college.

issues.economy: Stop planned cuts in expenditure, raise £8bn of taxes from the wealthiest and companies not paying their fair share, cut the deficit by half.
issues.education: Provided an extra £2.5bn a year for struggling school kids, protect education spending from cradle to college.
issues.environment: Cut CO2 emissions, reduce the risk of flooding.
issues.health: Increased the health budget each year to improve services and provide 6,000 more doctors, guarantee mental health equality by increasing health spending by £8bn a year.

images.caption: Liberal Democrat candidate for Epsom & Ewell

leaflet.additionalNotes: Repeal the failing Justice Secretary would: Chris Grayling, the Convention of Human Rights, removing 65 years of protection for minorities and the most vulnerable in society. We will stop him.
